abilitygroupdescription.p: Special abilities are extraordinary abilities or racial abilities not available to most characters in the usual course of events.

abilitydescription.p: The character has heightened senses when fighting unseen opponents. They are atuned to slight noises and minor air movements that give away the location of unseen attackers.

When a character with Blindsight is fighting an unseen opponent each time they try and attack the opponent, before they roll to attack, they roll a Blindsight check. If the Blindsight check is successful the character only suffers a -3 modifier for the rest of the encounter instead of the usual -6.
If the character makes a successful Luck check they may reroll their surprise roll. FIXME: how does this differ from REROLL?

abilitycheck.trigger: Anytime a character with this ability would Sprint (perform a double move action)

abilitydescription.p:
FIXME: definition of Sprint (or has that gone?)
Dwarves are natural sprinters. While slow to get moving, and not the most agile when it comes to dodging and quick changes of direction, Dwarves can build up a fair amount of speed in a straight line over time. Natural Sprinters get +3 to any Speed checks made to run.

abilitycheck.trigger: Character takes non-magical damage from a non-iron weapon

abilitydescription.p: The fey are resistant to damage from non-magically conductive sources. They reduce damage from non-ferrous metal weapons by their ability rank for each hit as a free action, a character with Fey Resilience 2 is hit by a wooden club for 5 hit points damage. This damage is reduced by 2 for their Fey Resilience so they instead take 3 damage.
Out of combat Fey creatures may make a magic check to magically heal +d6 health.
